page.title: 01The Central North of Jersey.
page.content:
Our area of study for this project is spread over two of the twelve{Parishes that form the administrative divisions of the Island, namely St. John and Trinity. More than half of the area is {sea.}
The block contains one important residential community,{St. John's {Village,}known as "Ville des Chenes," (Village of the Oaks.) This is being extended to the East at the time of this survey.
The{Parish Church of St. John, }a small{shopping precinct}and the {Parish Hall}are to be found close to the village.
The {land }is utilised mainly for both agricultural (potatoes) and dairy {farming.
